title: Academic Library Information Search Education: Strategies for Enhancing Effectiveness in Social Science Research Material Exploration

context.prior_knowledge: Basic smartphone usage understanding, general information retrieval experience, foundational knowledge of social science topics (e.g., social stratification, cultural diversity, civic rights), and basic experience in academic literature searches
context.additional_context: Learners primarily access the LMS via smartphones, requiring self-directed learning in non-real-time environments. Educational materials must be mobile-friendly, with content structured around social science research methodologies (literature analysis, data interpretation, historical context analysis). Particularly emphasizes approaches stressing resource retrieval and critical analysis for community problem-solving.

learning_goals: Learners will accurately interpret social science document-based materials explaining academic library database search procedures with ≥80% accuracy and evaluate their relevance to research topics.

Learners will successfully locate academic resources related to specific social issues (e.g., demographic changes, regional economic development) ≥3 times using provided search guides and perform analyses considering cultural contexts.

Based on 1-week experiences using document-based guides (e.g., library manuals, online tutorials) in social science information searches, learners will record ≥3 specific cases in reflective journals, each including ≥150-character reflective analyses (e.g., credibility assessment, topic relevance, societal impact).

resources: Video demonstration materials (under 5 minutes) within LMS
Virtual library account for search practice
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
